Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: 860KCo
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was good. As mentioned in other posts, the parking is terribly small. We arrived later in the evening, and were able to get the last spot available, however due to the many pillars, odd parking arrangement, it was troublesome to park. The overall appearance of the hotel is dismal, needs paint, renovations. The carpet on the floor was old, and the stairwells had broken windows. A very odd layout for a hotel as well. The elevator ride was sketchy, and the only ice machine is in the basement. However, the rooms were remarkably clean, and comfortable. The air conditioning did not work very well, however we were able to open the windows and let the room cool down. Also, the hotel was very quiet. Beds and pillows were super comfortable. The continental breakfast was okay. Typical waffle, toast, cereal and fruit. Would have been nice to see yogurt or another healthier option. Location is great - a five minute walk to St. Denis. Lots of little bistros and shops, and a 5 minutes cab ride to St. Laurent for night life. Overall, for under 100$ a night, its not a bad stay, if you are looking more to experience montreal, and not necessarily live in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel was alright.”
Reviews.Author: tintinarcher
Reviews.Content: For cheap travellers, this is a great hotel for you..!! I went to Montreal with my friend and was our first time... It was so convenient for us because everything is accessible to this hotel... The only thing that I'm not so happy about is the breakfast.. well thinking the hotel is cheap I do not have to expect great breakfast buffet.. it was light breakfast like breads, waffles, cereals, coffee, boiled eggs, and fruits... It was not bad but because I'm a egg and Bacon person, I was kind of a little dismay.. but the other than that everything is perfect..!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay when on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: imojen
Reviews.Content: the conference organisers booked us at this hotel for a week. we got a room with 2 queen beds at the 4th floor. the room was spacious enough that i was able to do yoga in the morning. i liked that the rooms include coffee and tea maker. the continental breakfast was very generous. we enjoyed the waffle maker the most. they also offered fruits which was a plus for me. the front desk people and the housekeeping staff were really nice but the staff at the breakfast place were not. what's nice about the hotel is that it was near a metro station and a convenience store. but what scares me about the hotel is the lift. it was a little rickety and noisy. we actually stayed there in october 2009.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: niveen a
Reviews.Content: I bought an online vouture from dealfind.com saying that ( $79 for $ 179 value) . so I bought it and I had a terrible experience and was charged the taxes twice once from dealfine.com and the second time at the hotel. Short story long , I asked the receptionist how much is the average per night she said $90-$99 so basically I paid more than the regular price and the value of my room was $99 !!! I paid $94 for deal find with the taxes and at the hotel they charged me$18 for taxes. so I paid more than what I would normally pay if I got the room at the hotel never trust Dealfind ... About the hotel , its not bad as in Location its middle of downtown . the service was Ok! however, I wouldn't go back again because at night you wont be able to sleep because you can hear everyone around you and the bed is not comfortable at all , no microwave no plastic plates or cups ,the room is toooooo small ! I am very upset because I don't like to be fooled not because of $$ but because I don't like to be ripped off ! I don't recommend it. you can find much nicer hotels with lower prices ..

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality, poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Ivan N
Reviews.Content: We had a really nasty experience with this hotel. When we arrived, the first thing that we noticed in the room was that the air conditioner was making a very loud roaring sound to the point that we couldn't even hear each other. There is no way we could have slept with the AC on while it was pretty hot in the room. Secondly, the sink in the washroom was clogged. We called reception and asked them to look into it while we had to leave. Realizing that they probably won't be able to fix the AC (it sounded like the rotor was dying) I confirmed that we'll be offered a different room if these problems are not taken care of. When we got back to the hotel, I inquired at the reception whether the issues were fixed and the receptionist confirmed that all was good. When we walked up to our room we found the same roaring AC with no signs of anybody even looking at it (I put some papers on top of the cover and they remained untouched). But worse, the whole washroom was covered in dirt including the towels, the sink was still clogged and was filled with water full of some dirt and hair and there were some tools all over the washroom. Surpassingly enough, that was not enough for the receptionist to move us to a different room. I had to call 3 times before we got a new room. Terrible. We would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KJW1304
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and always available for questions about the hotel and surrounding area. Fast check in, room ready, very clean rooms. Free breakfast included with waffle makers! Located right next to the bus terminal, adjacent to the main hub of the Montreal metro system, 5 minute walk from Montreal's Quartier Latin and St-Denis area, 5 minute walk to Montreal's Gay Village this hotel is in a very convenient location for anybody wishing to enjoy Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location for small budget!”
Reviews.Author: Karl F
Reviews.Content: If you used to stay at the Fairmont , Hilton or Sheraton maybe is not your type of Hotel! But for the rest of peoples who like traveling cheap is the place!! I had a good stay! The location is PERFECT close to everything!!!! Bus terminal, Metro, Restaurants , Nightlife! and shopping mall!! The staff was great, the checking was fast ! Maybe the elevator is a little bit scary but my room was perfect! Nice comfy Queen bed with comfy pillows ! The bathroom was a little bit small but clean and perfect! Free wifi and breakfast! For the breakfast they using plastic plates,forks and knifes but who cares!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: linds4516
Reviews.Content: We'd arrived by bus from New York and were glad that this property was just a short walk from the bus station and metro. The guy at reception was pleasant and we were quickly in our room, feeling welcome. And the room was all that we could desire, comfortable and well-appointed; it was simply pleasant with plenty of space for two people. Beds were comfortable. The only feature of this property I would call average was the breakfast: the typically limited Choice Hotels fare but at least one doesn't have to start the day in a strange city by searching for food. Room price was a little over $80 but with provincial, city and tourism taxes added, the total was around $104, making Montreal the most highly taxed city I've ever stayed in. Would I stay here again? Definitely. It's a real find in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: phoenix71
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel simply based on location. It was close to the bus terminal and Montreal's main metro station Berri-UQAM. Rue St Denis, a prime shopping and dinning location was also nearby. The staff were ok, neither overly accommodating and friendly nor rude. The hotel is rather old and that is reflected in the decor. The room we had was reasonably clean and serviceable however the bed was as hard as a rock. I woke up the next morning barely able to move. My back was so sore I had to take painkillers. Once the painkillers kicked in and I was able to walk again we went downstairs for breakfast. Not worth setting the alarm clock for. Muffins, toast, croissants, cold cereal and the ubiquitous DIY waffle maker served with some pretty terrible coffee. There are many good cafes in Montreal and if you choose to stay in this hotel you should make a point of finding one. As I said before, the location IS very convenient. The downside to being near the bus station, however, are the "colourful" people who tend to hang out near them. On our last night we encountered a hooker looking for cigarette butts on the side of the road. She started yelling at us in French, grabbed her crotch and wandered off. My wife and I were both glad to leave this place behind and on our next trip to Montreal will try to find a nicer place even if it isn't quite so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Katya R
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay!! It was very welcoming!! I had lots of fun staying in this hotel. It's very clean and relaxing. The location is effective. It's near the metro, a five minute walk. It's downtown near almost everything. I deffenetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: ccmkeri
Reviews.Content: Located in the Latin Quarter, pleasant, welcoming lobby with friendly, helpful staff who speak English. Rooms are spotless and nicely updated. Parking is on site at $17 per day, but arrive early to get a spot. Metro stop is close by, lots of restaurants within 2 blocks. About a 20 minute walk to the Old City. No microwave or mini fridge in room 334. Easy to use AC/heater. We were missing stoppers for sink and tub. Staff promptly brought replacements.

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay, Great rate, Nothing to complain about."”
Reviews.Author: Samantha M
Reviews.Content: The only negative aspect I found was the parking, but other than that there is nothing to complain about. The staff is great so nice and efficient. Friendly & approachable management if you need anything, the entire staff is very helpful. Good location metro is walking distance and so are several good restaurants. The room was very clean, the beds we're comfortable and the AC was not a problem. We had about 4 rooms booked for that night and all of the comments were positive. If you want to avoid the parking, just take the metro. Other than that I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I will not go to that hotel again ever”
Reviews.Author: belal k
Reviews.Content: I stay one night and i will never do it again in that hotel...i paid more than 190 $ for one queen bed room ....the room was not so bad but the wash room was not good ...i took the elevator and the garbage man came with us and they are using the dirty carriage very bad smell .... The parking lots was so small and i was lucky i get the last spot and i drive on illegal way to park ..... i put the A/C on to keep me room cold when I go back after a while and I notice they put it off ....in the morning they knock my door to clean the room and disturb me .....by the way i negotiate the price with them when i want to pay the increase the amount and say there is extra taxes ....

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for stay even free”
Reviews.Author: Benhor
Reviews.Content: Not clean Some sheets are too old You always have bus terminal noise

Reviews.Title: “Waste Time and money in crapy hotel”
Reviews.Author: beh S
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while I am here, it is dirty and most of the room are noisy because the hotel is facing a city bus terminal. the price is too high for what you get at all. I don't recommended to stay here even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay !!”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal on a business trip when i booked at this hotel for a week. I never had any problems concerning the room, everything worked well and the service was great. My room has been cleaned properly every time i left and came back. The location is perfect, close to pretty much everything you need. Parking works on a first come first served basis so if there is a spot u can get it, if u are a good driver u should have no problems cornering a pillar or two. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown so food, movies, shows or parties are all easily accessible. I will definitely stay here next time, best overall value !!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Cowtowner A
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I spent a weekend here and had a great time. The location was great , close to restaurants and bars in the latin quarter. Also, steps away from the metro.the rooms seemed rather newly renovated with dark rich colours and the beds were comfy. The front desk staff were helpful and polite. The price is good for the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and run by crooks...”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Casteel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an way overpriced dump. I was fooled by the pictures and booked in here, at a very pricey rate. Despite paying over $150 night I had to pay another $18 day to park in the "garage," (in advance) with no guarantee of a spot in the very small lot. The bedding would have disgraced a stable, seriously, the blankets and sheets were rags. The elevator is frightening, I rode it once and took the stairs after that. Security is a joke, there is a back door with no locks that opens to the street, allowing access to the hotel 24 hours a day to anyone. The air conditioning was never able to get the room below about 80 degrees during the day. The bathroom was moldy and lit only by a very dim fluorescent fixture. The TV offered very few channels. The best aspect of this hotel is the location, however the neighborhood is flooded with homeless people who will accost you, especially in the evening. Here is the kicker - I sent an email to Comfort Inns after my stay complaining about the lousy condition of the hotel. The hotel owners then billed my credit card an additional $300. When I questioned this charge I was told it was because I soiled the room carpet with hair dye. Leaving aside for a moment that I doubt you could have noted anything short of a gallon of bright red paint on the hideous and badly stained carpet...I don't dye my hair and if I did, why would I do so in a hotel room? Isn't that something hair salons do? I am still fighting the charge through my credit card company, of course it is especially difficult because it was incurred in a foreign nation. My advice - avoid this flea motel at all costs and Comfort Inns in general.

Reviews.Title: “OK at a discount price”
Reviews.Author: marktwothousand
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on 2-3 occasions now at a discounted rate of $80-$100 and I would not pay more than $120. You could probably find better accomodations if you book a rate of $120+ at the 4* across the street. That being said, I am pleased with this no-frills hotel and will continue to stay there. This time, I had a room with what I could actually call, "a view". From the 6th floor east, I could actually see Olympic Stadium and the Jacques Cartier Bridge. What a surprise. I've only ever faced the courtyard and buses before. Room was good quality, decent furniture. Bed was soft in places, but not uncomfortable. I was surprised to find my room actually had a sofa too, it was a good-sized pad. Quibbles about my stay: - The breakfast is a poor, poor production. It was almost impossible to find a table, and everyone rushes down at the last minute between 9:15 and 9:30 to get whatever is left. Instead of starting brekkie at 6:30-9:30 they should have it 7:00-10:00, at least on weekends. The line up for the waffle maker (that's what everyone is after) is about 5-10 people when it is busy so it can take a good 15 minutes to make waffles for yourself if you have to wait. This breakfast experience is similar to my last one when I stayed here, so they really need to do something about this, otherwise is just a token "breakfast is included". I'd describe it as "Continental Plus". - Elevator: The same picture has been in the elevator since this was Hotel Taj Mahal. The whole car needs a complete reno. Too bumpy, slow. If you don't want to be bothered with the elevator, request a floor 4 or below and use the stairs. - The room had traces of smoking. It wasn't enough to bother me, but you could smell it when you went into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn deeply disappoints”
Reviews.Author: HappinessBinbrook
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days in two different rooms.Even though the hotel was in a good area for access to sightseeing I was deeply disappointed in the overall maintenance of the hotel. The staff were courteous at all times.The hotel needs a complete overall of carpeting & wallpaper throughout. I was shocked at the bathroom because I have never witnessed such severe mould and bathtub discoloration in my 30 years of travelling all over the world. I agree with other travellers about the jerky elevator. It was risky riding with any uncovered beverages because you were guaranteed of it spilling. The breakfast was passable but not much to choose from. The rooms at the back of the hotel faced onto the bus station so you hear beeping of busses all the time backing up. The air conditioner was very noisy. The only strange thing we found was that the coffee dispenser in the lobby had sugar on the sidetable but no creamers. When we asked at the front desk the clerk said we had to ask for it because it was kept in a fridge in the back. Huh? Well that's inconvenient if the desk is busy and you just want a creamer for your coffee. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, decent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: sycha
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel in the past month. Location is great, walking distance from most sites, including Old Montreal. We were able to park for free in the street both times. Otherwise, hotel has limited parking (for a fee) and next door, there's a huge indoor parking lot for $12 per 24-hour period. Rooms are quite adequate and in good repair. Elevator ride is a bit bumpy. Free breakfast includes waffles as in many other Comfort Inns, but the waffle maker here turns out four small crispy waffles per serving which are quite nice. No food or drinks are allowed out of the breakfast area. Free internet station in the lobby. Main inter-city bus terminal is located in the back of the hotel but if the room AC or fan is on, you don't hear much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired and dark.”
Reviews.Author: MaiseyDaisey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to visit the 'tourist' parts of Montreal - close to subway (Berri - UQAM) and roughly in the 'Latin Quarter'. The parking is first come, first served - it is a small area and very tight (Compact car rather than Full size) and at CAD$17+taxes/Â£13 does add a cost to your room bill, but if you can get a spot, it does mean you don't have to worry about your car on the street or in some distant public car park. Staff were polite on check-in/out - but in writing this review and checking my details, I now realise I booked, and paid for, a "Newer room with City view" neither of which we got. Our two double bed room was on the small side and had a view of other hotel windows. The decor was dark green and this, along with the overshadowing of the facing building made the room very dark and dingy. But it was clean and the beds comfortable. Free WiFi was very useful, but no microwave/'fridge. There is only one small lift for quite a large building and it is rather rickety. The complimentary breakfast was the 'usual' cereals/coffee/waffles - I guess at CAD$148/Â£97 a night for 3 adults excluding parking (Â£110 with) in the centre seemed just about acceptable. There is a good supermarket underneath Le Chateau opposite Place Ã‰milie-Gamelin just down the road for snacks for a day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE AGAIN EVEN IF I GET PAID!”
Reviews.Author: w_c155019
Reviews.Content: This place completely ruined my whole Montreal trip! First, when i first checked in, the lady told me that i would have to pay an additional $12 + 17.83 percent tax for every additonal person staying per night and i had 5 people including myself which means i am paying over $100 including tax just to have them stay with me in the same room. Initially i planned on sneaking them into the room instead so we don't have to pay it, but after we decided that we will pay, the manager by the name of Adrian told my friend and i that the room only allows a maximum of 4 people because of fire policy which means that we would have to book another room regardless. I feel as though they are trying to rip me off because first the lady told me that we would have to pay additonal and now they're saying that we would have to book a second room. I've lived in quite a number of hotels, and i've never heard of that policy before. And Mr. Adrian addressed that if police was to come that all of us will end up in jail. During our whole conversation, he was very rude. I highly doubt the professionalism of this hotel as he only created more problems for me instead of helping me solve my current issues. We ended up having to switch 2 different hotel rooms because the sinks were either broken or chipped. We ended up climbing a whole lot of stairs because of how the hotel is structured. I became so intolerant i had my friend go with him to check the room before we moved everything there. During that whole time, the manager did not offer to help us carry any of our belongings when he clearly saw how the 2 of us were struggling. After we FINALLY settled down in a room, our friends came in to get their belongings and the manager STALKED them to our room and stood outside watching us move our stuff. I feel so humiliated by his behavior when he was aware that we have another hotel room next door. After my friends left, i closed the door and being the crappy hotel that it is, the door slammed shut. In a split second, the manager knocked on our door and told us to not slam the door or else he would call the police on us for disturbance. In addition to that, parking is HORRIBLE. We paid $17+ tax per night for parking, and it wasnt even a legit parking. My car and everyone else's car was very vulnerable to scratches and what not with all those poles and stuff in the middle of no where. The way you enter and the way you exit is from the exact same "door". Their called "parking lot" was not even capable of parking 20 cars and they had 100+ rooms? Ironic much? And when i complained to the manager, he insisted that there are parking space and that it was good, but i didn't pay $17+ for a crappy parking spot which could potenially cost me more if my car were to get scratched. On the last day when i checked out the rep i dealt with was much nicer and more professional. Sadly, the manager that i had to deal with was nothing in comparison. In conclusion, i strongly do not recommend this place for anyone whether it's just a one night think or long term because right next to them, there's this place where they charge wayyy cheaper, and their rooms might not be as nice, but their service is 100 x better. And surprisingly during my friends stay at that place, the rep told him that we can call the police on Comfort Hotel as there are no such fire policy of 4 occupancies. My friends and i will for sure not stay at this place, and if you decide to stay with them, good luck and i hope that their management will change during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBooDog
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and super convenient to the Montreal Metro system but when we were there the elevator was in need of repair. It's not that the elevator did not work, but that it jerked so much at start and stop that I literally came away with sore knees. I would not recommend this location (or plan on taking the stairs) until management addresses the issue. Would have been rated four stars if not for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “NO”
Reviews.Author: lcesmith
Reviews.Content: Room needs to be updated, mold in bathroom, floors looked dirty, no hot water one night and the next morning. Rugs needed to be vacuumed. Elevator was questionable, rail in elevator broken, rail up the stairs from lobby broken. Throw up in the elevator. Room was left open our last day after cleaners. Breakfast was okay, but first day after having eggs had stomach problems and spent the day in bed. Did not eat hard boiled eggs again. NO FRUIT, NO YOGURT. They had two Asian tour groups in at our time of stay with 4 people per room, may be why there was no hot water. Girls at front desk were really nice and helpful. My husband's quote "Comfort Inn at the Ganges River"
